alert.note: Alert for Bee; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; La Salle; Live Oak; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 15 at 6:45PM CDT until June 15 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 120 expected. For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 115 expected. * WHERE...La Salle, Live Oak, Bee, Webb, Jim Wells, Inland Kleberg, Inland Nueces and Inland San Patricio Counties. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from noon to 8 PM CDT Friday. For the Heat Advisory, until 9 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bee; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; La Salle; Live Oak; Webb
